Is this depiction of swinging just NTR?
1. Does the other girl remark on how disappointing MC is compared to the other guy? Yes
2. Does the heroine regularly have sex with the other guy before and/or more frequently than with the MC? Yes
3. Do both girls service the other guy while the MC is forced to watch? Yes
4. Does the heroine do things for the other guy she would never consider with the MC? Yes
5. Is more time dedicated to the heroine+other guy than any scene with the MC? Yes
6. Does the heroine have sex with the other guy with no plans to inform the MC? Yes(she was caught, but there is no indication that she was in any hurry to inform him)

Prep Time 10 minutes
 Cook Time25 minutes
 Total Time35 minutes
 Calories 250kcal
 Ingredients
 2 boneless chicken breasts
 2 cloves of garlic
 1 piece of ginger of 2 cm
 1 medium onion
 1 large tomato
 1/2 cup of coconut milk
 1 tablespoon curry powder
 ½ tablespoon of cumin
 ½ tablespoon turmeric
 Cayenne pepper optional
 Salt to taste
 Pepper to taste
 Step-by-step elaboration
 Chop the chicken into medium cubes.
 Cut the onion and garlic into small cubes.
 Grate the ginger and mash the tomato.
 In a deep frying pan, add a little vegetable oil and cook the onion, garlic, ginger and tomato.
 Add all the spices: curry, cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper, black pepper and a pinch of salt.  Stir well for a couple of minutes and lower the heat to half.
 Now add the minced chicken and cook until it has been sealed on all sides.
 Put ½ glass of water and mix.
 Let it cook over low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

And as for those who enjoyed it for whatever reason, Uten Ameka may be immeasurably grateful for your support for wherever they are. Plot aside, the art itself is beautiful and obviously took a lot of time and effort to make. To be an artist of such skill is clearly commendable by itself, nevertheless of anything else

I speak not to degrade the grievances of those that hate this manga, rather I talk based on what I know. An Artist's vision like Uten Ameka's vision is their vision - clearly to draw any manga with the intention of making everyone happy is an impossible effort to even think of. Does this make it any more good or bad? Certainly not. For it is not the manga itself that is the main problem necessarily, but rather our perception of it - and this we can change at any time. For those that hate this, let your problems rest, in your own hope and mine that you may one day forget about this - and move on with your life.

But if a mere challenge to all of your morals, values and desires from a mere doujin is enough to enrage some of you, does that not go to show how fragile you can be? Putting aside whether or not any are attached to the characters themselves, doesn't it prove how easy you can be manipulated by 
a manga's plot and ideas when it merely defies what you think is best?

For these reasons and many more, I can understand why a lot of you guys are upset, even angry or livid about both manga's. I get it. Without even thinking about the ending of the 1st one, I felt considerable grief about it for a bit before I was able to reason with myself and think about it. It feels like NTR, cheating, or even just plain wrong for a number of reasons all of you have made clear that I can understand with, since it was exactly how I felt about this at first before I came to my senses about all of it

3: Also isn't stated directly whether Tomboy MC is doing it only for the benefit of better sex with the MC, or because she now prefers the other guy's gear other MC's. If it's the former, it partially nullifies the main point of sexual and emotional reconciliation to some since they're still having sex with each other, but if it's the latter, it of course makes it full on cheating to a great many against this manga

So from what I've been able to get from all of this, those against the plot of this seem to have 3 main problems 
1: Ending is weird, off putting and even bad since chad character came inside of Tomboy MC before MC's date with him  - apparently without him knowing, but they we're still turned on nonetheless. This seems to make it borderline NTR, amongst other problems that have been cited 
2: By "mutual consent", it isn't stated directly that swapping is still properly done between the 4 with them, MC with the Gyaru MC, and Tomboy MC with the other guy. By this logic, it seems that only Tomboy MC are still having sex with each other, but still with the consent of MC, making it consensual NTR? Still kinda blurry along these lines.
Also Gods below, the comment section is in full scale rebellion over this. This is gonna take a while to read to get a sense about what's getting everyone at everyone else's throats for...

Ending: "We still enjoy swapping with mutual consent." So, GF banging Pretty Boy is permissible.  "B-But you like it when he cums inside me, don't you...?" Which she says as she's feeling up his hardon. Okay, they're all still swapping, meaning that offscreen MC is also banging the gyaru. And her attitude is that she got creampied to turn on MC. As to, "Oh no, he's going to let another guy impregnate his GF!!", although he says use condoms, we don't know if she's on the pill, if it's a safe day. She's safe for 22 days out of 28, so she might know the odds. Or they might have no problems with morning after pills or abortions. This is NOT vanilla, but it's NOT NTR. It's not what I'd do IRL, but we end up with this couple happily looking forward to having a ton of sex with each other. It is definitely a weird story & one that is hard to pigeon hole.
